questions.question: What is a molecule?
options: A tiny creature living in the ocean.
A group of two or more atoms (the smallest unit of a substance that has the same qualities of that substance).
A type of rock found in caves.

questions.question: What are atoms in molecules held together by?
What stays the same in a chemical reaction?
options: The number of atoms and the mass
The size of the container and temperature

questions.question: What changes in a chemical reaction?
What are the three states of matter?
What happens to atoms during a chemical reaction?
options: They rearrange to make new substances

questions.question: What does H2O mean?
options: Two atoms of oxygen and one of hydrogen
Two atoms of hydrogen and one of oxygen

questions.question: What are elements?
options: Substances made of one type of atom

questions.question: What is a compound?
options: A group of atoms all the same
A substance made of two or more elements

questions.question: What is a property?
options: A type of land where a house is built
A tool used in a lab
Something observed or measured without changing the substance
A container used to store chemicals

questions.question: What is the periodic table?
options: A chart of all known atoms

questions.question: What are chemical bonds made of?
What is a reagent?
options: A substance added to cause a reaction

questions.question: What happens when an atomâ€™s outer shell is not full?
options: It changes into a different atom
It forms chemical bonds with other atoms

questions.question: What is the purpose of chemical bonding between atoms?
options: To stabilize atoms by filling their electron shells

questions.question: What is a product in a chemical reaction?
options: The item created from a chemical reaction

questions.question: What is a supersaturated solution?
options: A liquid that is colder than usual
A solution that has less water than usual
A liquid that has more dissolved particles than what could normally be achieved
A mixture of gases and liquids
